channel.title: Home on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Home on My New Hugo Site

item.title: 23 November 2023
item.description: ive got some education on the subject and a liiittle experience with qiskit wanted to know what kinds of algorithms get used in particle simulations. that’s just chemical simulations reallly. so i turned to this article and discovered that of the suggested algorithms that are available in the qiskit library, we’ve got Trotterization. Suzuki Trotter specifically. So I guess that’s what we’re going with. Also, got this repo where someone started doing the work of setting up standard model visualization things so i’ll fork that and add python to it for qiskit

item.title: 25 November 2023
item.description: was a struggle but used these resources one two and figured out a structure like this (screenshot of and link to private repo) (screenshot of and link to public repo) note: the repos’ structures might have changed since this post was made. Refer to the screenshots if so and determined that for setup you’re going to want to follow these steps. details further down the page install dependencies (links?) make a github pages repo (link) (also stuff about watching it build and deploy) hugo new site or whatever run hugo to generate the public/ folder where your compiled code is.
